Notes: Microsoft uses .NET Core for most of its backend services and Azure tools.
Entity Framework Core is widely used in Microsoft's internal .NET applications.
Meta created and maintains React for all its web interfaces (Facebook, Instagram).
Google uses JavaScript extensively across its web products like Gmail and Docs.
Google uses Node.js for many of its scalable backend services.
Apple uses Swift as the main language for all iOS and macOS app development.
Amazon uses .NET Core in some AWS services and enterprise solutions.
Unity Technologies uses its own Unity engine to build and demo games.
Figma is built with and designed using its own Figma tool.
CrowdStrike uses Wireshark for deep network traffic analysis in threat detection.
IBM uses Python and Pandas for data processing in its AI and analytics platforms.
Palantir uses Scikit-learn for machine learning models in its data platforms.
Netflix uses React for parts of its frontend UI alongside other frameworks.
GitHub's web interface relies heavily on JavaScript for dynamic interactions.
Google uses SQL in BigQuery and many internal data systems.
